chapter.title: Books
chapter.para: A book generally has one or more authors, a title, a place and time of publication and an extent in number of pages.
The place of publication is broken down into the name of the city that is the chief domicile of the publishing house, and the name of the publishing house.

ul.li: Diamond, Jared. Guns, Germs, and Steel: The Fates of Human Societies. New York: W. W. Norton and Company, 1997.
Bird, Kai, and Martin J. Sherwin. American Prometheus: The Triumph and Tragedy of J. Robert Oppenheimer. New York: Alfred A. Knopf, 2005.

chapter.para: In connection with place and time of publication, there is information regarding the edition. Since the Tamboti simplfied input forms are primarily meant to be used for cataloguing first editions of Cluster publications, input options for edition are not shown. Edition information can be found on the "Origin Info" tab.
Extent in number of pages is generally not shown in the bibliographical notice for a book.
"Role terms" such as editor, translator or illustrator are not available in the Basic Input Forms, but can be chosen on the "Name Info" tab (along with more than 200 other terms).
